events.name: Algorithms used in Games: Any-Angle Path Finding in Open Spaces
events.description: The answer to finding the shortest path between two points on a graph is well-known. However, strategy games and other real-life cases often involve wide-open spaces without well-defined graphs, how does one construct shortest paths between arbitrary points in a space? We give an overview of the most effective algorithms for generating realistic paths using a grid-based approximation of open spaces. Oh Shunhao is a Computer Science and Mathematics student at NUS. He enjoys mathematical problems and algorithms, and loves sharing about them with like-minded people. He also makes games in his spare time. He is currently working with Health Visuals to produce a game for the app store. His current research work involves working on finding fast any-angle pathfinding algorithms for use in games, as well as developing cool visualisations for them.
